skill.name: managing-workflow
skill.description:
Manages the specification-driven development workflow. Use this skill when the user runs /orbit,
requests to "define feature", "create plan", "implement", or needs workflow guidance.
It detects the current phase from artifacts and executes the appropriate action.

skill.author: BrendanShields

security_audit.summary: This is a legitimate workflow management skill for specification-driven development. All code operates locally within the project .spec directory. No network access, no credential handling, and no external command execution beyond controlled Node.js script invocations. Behavior matches stated purpose.

content.value_statement: This skill provides a structured workflow for specification-driven development where artifacts serve as the source of truth. It automates phase detection, validates transitions, and guides users through initialize, specification, clarification, planning, implementation, and archive phases.
actual_capabilities: Detects current workflow phase from spec.md frontmatter and suggests next action
Validates phase transitions before proceeding with mandatory phase gates
Creates and manages feature artifacts (spec.md, plan.md, tasks.md, metrics.md)
Tracks progress with timestamps and activity logging
Provides quick templates for simple features to reduce overhead
limitations: Requires .spec directory structure and proper frontmatter format
Does not execute implementation tasks directly (delegates to task-implementer agent)
No support for parallel feature workflows
Limited to text-based workflow tracking within local project

use_cases.title: Track feature development
use_cases.description: Track feature progress from idea through implementation with structured artifacts

use_cases.title: Enforce development standards
use_cases.description: Ensure all features follow specification-driven process with approval gates

use_cases.title: Automate workflow guidance
use_cases.description: Guide users through development phases with intelligent suggestions

prompt_templates.title: Start new feature
prompt_templates.prompt: Run /orbit to start a new feature. Ask me for the feature name and description, then create spec.md with proper frontmatter.

prompt_templates.title: Check progress
prompt_templates.prompt: Run /orbit to check the current workflow state. Show me which phase each active feature is in and what needs to be done next.

prompt_templates.title: Create implementation plan
prompt_templates.prompt: Run /orbit to transition to planning phase. Create plan.md based on spec.md requirements and validate the plan with me before marking complete.

prompt_templates.title: Archive completed feature
prompt_templates.prompt: Run /orbit to check for complete features. If all tasks are done, ask me to archive and move the feature to .spec/archive/.

output_examples.input: Run /orbit to manage my feature workflow
output: Next Action: Create tasks.md from plan.md
Tip: Use quick-tasks template for simple features

output_examples.input: I want to move to implementation phase

best_practices: Always run /orbit at session start to detect current state and get next action suggestions
Validate phase transitions before proceeding to ensure all artifacts exist
Use quick templates for simple features to reduce overhead while maintaining structure
anti_patterns: Skipping directly to implementation without creating plan.md and tasks.md first
Marking features as complete when unchecked tasks remain in tasks.md
Not resolving [CLARIFY] tags before moving from clarification to planning phase

faq.question: Does this skill work with any project?
faq.answer: Requires .spec directory structure. Run /orbit to initialize the workflow framework if not present.

faq.question: What are the maximum number of tasks supported?
faq.answer: No hard limit, but recommends grouping related tasks into parallel sets with dependencies for complex features.

faq.question: Can I integrate with external project management tools?
faq.answer: Currently operates on local .spec artifacts only. External integrations would require custom extensions.

faq.question: Is my data safe with this skill?
faq.answer: All operations are local within the .spec directory. No data is sent externally.

faq.question: Why is my phase transition being blocked?
faq.answer: Phase gates require all prerequisite artifacts to exist. Check that spec.md, plan.md, and tasks.md are properly created first.

faq.question: How does this compare to other workflow tools?
faq.answer: Focuses on artifact-driven workflow with explicit phase gates. Designed for AI-assisted development with human review checkpoints.
